meanings.definition: A bolt with a looped head used for attaching ropes or cables.
meanings.sent1: The sailor fastened the rope to the eyebolt on the ship.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker installed the eyebolt to secure the cables.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey swung from the eyebolt, pretending to be a pirate.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes locked onto the eyebolt, a symbol of safety amidst the storm.
meanings.sent5: The shiny eyebolt gleamed in the sunlight, beckoning for the rope to be attached.

meanings.sent1: He decided to eyebolt the shelf to the wall to prevent it from falling.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter will eyebolt the beam for extra support.
meanings.sent3: She eyebolted the door shut, jokingly pretending it was a vault.
meanings.sent4: The idea eyebolted into his mind, securing his decision.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the accident eyebolted him into action, ensuring safety measures were taken.
